dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, uh, is this right? Shopify's CEO, Tobias Lutke, is apparently in six billion dollars of debt? Six. Billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, uh, is this right? Shopify's C E O, Tobias Lutke, is apparently in six billion dollars of debt? Six. Billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...pushing the net worth of its 39-year-old CEO Tobias Lutke north of $6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's, um, what the article says. But it's not the whole story, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's, um, what the article says. But it's not the whole story, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article does not state that Tobias Lutke is in debt; it states his net worth is north of $6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: What whole story? Sounds like, uh, another tech giant, you know, imploding. Who cares, really?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What whole story? Sounds like, uh, another tech giant, you know, imploding. Who cares, really?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thanks to skyrocketing demand for its online business-building tools, the Ottawa-based e-commerce giant has brought a windfall to its public market investors. Its value peaked at $84 billion last week...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but this is different. It's about Bessemer Venture Partners, one of their earliest investors. They actually, like, won here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but this is different. It's about Bessemer Venture Partners, one of their earliest investors. They actually, like, won here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But for one of its earliest investors, San Francisco-based Bessemer Venture Partners, the hype around the company is bittersweet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Won? By, uh, being associated with a company that briefly became a penny stock? Sounds like a weird win.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Won? By, uh, being associated with a company that briefly became a penny stock? Sounds like a weird win.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the past month, Shopifys share price has doubled after it generated $470 million in revenue in the first quarter...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no. They avoided losing, like, $17 billion. By getting out early.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no. They avoided losing, like, seventeen dollars billion. By getting out early.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By exiting Shopify two years ago, Bessemer left at least $17 billion on the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Seventeen billion dollars? Are you serious? Who even has that much to lose?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seventeen billion dollars? Are you serious? Who even has that much to lose?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they had a huge stake. But they, um, sold all their shares by 2018. Before the big crash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they had a huge stake. But they, um, sold all their shares by twenty eighteen. Before the big crash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article describes a surge in Shopify's value, not a crash: 'In the past month, Shopifys share price has doubled...'

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, they just, uh, got lucky? Or had some kind of inside info?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they just, uh, got lucky? Or had some kind of inside info?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They called it a "crystal ball." One partner, Alex Ferrara, he said he knew from the start it wouldn't have "massive success."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They called it a crystal ball. One partner, Alex Ferrara, he said he knew from the start it wouldn't have massive success.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Says the venture capitalist: We didnt have a crystal ball.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, a crystal ball. Everyone's got one of those, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, a crystal ball. Everyone's got one of those, I guess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but it's rare. A professor even said it was, um, a "significant smart investment" because venture firms usually build huge stakes in failing startups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but it's rare. A professor even said it was, um, a significant smart investment because venture firms usually build huge stakes in failing startups.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...Bessemers stake in Shopify stands out as a significant missed opportunity in venture investing because it is rare that a venture capital firm would have built such a large stake in a hot startup, says Will Gornal...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the big takeaway is: if you're a VC, try not to lose all your money? Thanks for the hot tip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the big takeaway is: if you're a V C, try not to lose all your money? Thanks for the hot tip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's about discerning a truly bad investment. A lot of other early investors, like, uh, even the CEO, actually were swindled into debt.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's about discerning a truly bad investment. A lot of other early investors, like, uh, even the C E O, actually were swindled into debt.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some of Shopifys early investors were being minted as billionaires even before the pandemic struck, including its CEO Lutke...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Swindled? By their own company? That's messy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Swindled? By their own company? That's messy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So Bessemer’s move, it’s not just about them. It's about how rare it is to get it this right when everyone else is, like, losing billions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So Bessemer's move, it's not just about them. It's about how rare it is to get it this right when everyone else is, like, losing billions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By exiting Shopify two years ago, Bessemer left at least $17 billion on the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, still sounds like a lot of rich people playing with Monopoly money. But, um, okay, point taken. It's a smart loss.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, still sounds like a lot of rich people playing with Monopoly money. But, um, okay, point taken. It's a smart loss.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article frames the situation as a 'significant missed opportunity,' not a 'smart loss.' Bessemer's investment was profitable, but they missed out on much larger gains.
